intro: Acer × polymorphum var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf maple, is a hybrid deciduous tree or shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its small, rounded form and delicate, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras as its fruit. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental landscaping. Its compact size and seasonal color changes make it a valuable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
